talk.author: did:plc:a6pswlwbhhsflmamyrwgocrl
talk.utter:
Holy crap, I got less than two weeks.
What to do for gifts.
I mean, I can't think of anything I want that's affordable as a gift (even costing several hundred pooled by the family) let alone anything I'd care to have OTHER PEOPLE choose and buy for ME.
Gifts for other people?
Completely clueless.

talk.author: did:plc:a6pswlwbhhsflmamyrwgocrl
talk.utter:
I'm picky enough a consumer that I have trouble finding stuff I'd care to own.
Gifted clothes are especially problematical.
I sometimes hate myself for being inflexibly picky in so many ways.

talk.author: did:plc:hvmia6yl4ibsnu2cflddtfr5
talk.utter: This is why I like not celebrating Christmas. I get gifts throughout the year whenever I find something I know someone will like

talk.author: did:plc:a6pswlwbhhsflmamyrwgocrl
talk.utter:
Yeah, that too.
Some gifts can go stale in months, like the way memes curdle.

talk.author: did:plc:a6pswlwbhhsflmamyrwgocrl
talk.utter:
Please elaborate.
When I say "stale," I don't always mean in the edible sense.

talk.author: did:plc:wnopom6k6hamafz7vsk4i5rm
talk.utter:
Stale in this case being "Getting bored of one thing and going on to the next big thing."

IE: A Fad/phase ending which brings the next Fad/phase

talk.author: did:plc:a6pswlwbhhsflmamyrwgocrl

Okay, so far so good.
How does ethnicity play a part in this?
